quote: Everything that irritates us about others can lead us to an understanding of ourselves.
author: Carl Jung

quote: Work like you don't need the money. Love like you've never been hurt. Dance like nobody's watching.
author: Satchel Paige

quote: The journey of a thousand miles begins with one step.
author: Lao Tzu

quote: It's better to be a lion for a day than a sheep all your life.
author: Elizabeth Kenny

quote: For beautiful eyes, look for the good in others; for beautiful lips, speak only words of kindness; and for poise, walk with the knowledge that you are never alone.
author: Audrey Hepburn

quote: Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: It's not what you look at that matters, it's what you see.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: Discipline is the bridge between goals and accomplishment.
author: Jim Rohn

quote: In every walk with nature one receives far more than he seeks.
author: John Muir

quote: Honesty is the first chapter in the book of wisdom.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: People don't notice whether it's winter or summer when they're happy.
author: Anton Chekhov

quote: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
author: Socrates

quote: To enjoy good health, to bring true happiness to one's family, to bring peace to all, one must first discipline and control one's own mind. If a man can control his mind he can find the way to Enlightenment, and all wisdom and virtue will naturally come to him.
author: Buddha

quote: Talent is God given. Be humble. Fame is man-given. Be grateful. Conceit is self-given. Be careful.
author: John Wooden

quote: Don't gain the world and lose your soul; wisdom is better than silver or gold.
author: Bob Marley

quote: Wisdom is oftentimes nearer when we stoop than when we soar.
author: William Wordsworth

quote: We are made wise not by the recollection of our past, but by the responsibility for our future.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Because you are women, people will force their thinking on you, their boundaries on you. They will tell you how to dress, how to behave, who you can meet and where you can go. Don't live in the shadows of people's judgement. Make your own choices in the light of your own wisdom.
author: Amitabh Bachchan

quote: Adopt the pace of nature: her secret is patience.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: The pessimist complains about the wind; the optimist expects it to change; the realist adjusts the sails.
author: William Arthur Ward

quote: Our character is what we do when we think no one is looking.
author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.

quote: It's not what happens to you, but how you react to it that matters.
author: Epictetus

quote: A good head and a good heart are always a formidable combination.
author: Nelson Mandela

quote: By three methods we may learn wisdom: First, by reflection, which is noblest; Second, by imitation, which is easiest; and third by experience, which is the bitterest.
author: Confucius

quote: It's the little details that are vital. Little things make big things happen.
author: John Wooden

quote: Whatever you do in life, surround yourself with smart people who'll argue with you.
author: John Wooden

quote: Science is organized knowledge. Wisdom is organized life.
author: Immanuel Kant

quote: The more you like yourself, the less you are like anyone else, which makes you unique.
author: Walt Disney

quote: A man must be big enough to admit his mistakes, smart enough to profit from them, and strong enough to correct them.
author: John C. Maxwell

quote: A tree is known by its fruit; a man by his deeds. A good deed is never lost; he who sows courtesy reaps friendship, and he who plants kindness gathers love.
author: Saint Basil

quote: God grant me the serenity to accept the things I cannot change, the courage to change the things I can, and the wisdom to know the difference.
author: Reinhold Niebuhr

quote: Obstacles are those frightful things you see when you take your eyes off your goal.
author: Henry Ford

quote: Knowledge is of no value unless you put it into practice.
author: Anton Chekhov

quote: Music is a higher revelation than all wisdom and philosophy.
author: Ludwig van Beethoven

quote: Grief can be the garden of compassion. If you keep your heart open through everything, your pain can become your greatest ally in your life's search for love and wisdom.
author: Rumi

quote: Those who improve with age embrace the power of personal growth and personal achievement and begin to replace youth with wisdom, innocence with understanding, and lack of purpose with self-actualization.
author: Bo Bennett

quote: Wisdom, compassion, and courage are the three universally recognized moral qualities of men.
author: Confucius

quote: When it is obvious that the goals cannot be reached, don't adjust the goals, adjust the action steps.
author: Confucius

quote: Genius is one percent inspiration and ninety-nine percent perspiration.
author: Thomas A. Edison

quote: Honesty is the best policy.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Just as treasures are uncovered from the earth, so virtue appears from good deeds, and wisdom appears from a pure and peaceful mind. To walk safely through the maze of human life, one needs the light of wisdom and the guidance of virtue.
author: Buddha

quote: There are many ways of going forward, but only one way of standing still.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quote: If you don't know where you are going, any road will get you there.
author: Lewis Carroll

quote: Knowledge comes, but wisdom lingers. It may not be difficult to store up in the mind a vast quantity of facts within a comparatively short time, but the ability to form judgments requires the severe discipline of hard work and the tempering heat of experience and maturity.
author: Calvin Coolidge

quote: The greater danger for most of us lies not in setting our aim too high and falling short; but in setting our aim too low, and achieving our mark.
author: Michelangelo

quote: The way you see people is the way you treat them, and the way you treat them is what they become.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: You always have two choices: your commitment versus your fear.
author: Sammy Davis, Jr.

quote: Never interrupt your enemy when he is making a mistake.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: Imagination is more important than knowledge.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Beware of false knowledge; it is more dangerous than ignorance.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Silence is true wisdom's best reply.
author: Euripides

quote: It is not wisdom but Authority that makes a law.
author: Thomas Hobbes

quote: There are three faithful friends - an old wife, an old dog, and ready money.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: It is time to remember that old wisdom our soldiers will never forget: that whether we are black or brown or white, we all bleed the same red blood of patriots, we all enjoy the same glorious freedoms, and we all salute the same great American Flag.
author: Donald Trump

quote: To acquire knowledge, one must study; but to acquire wisdom, one must observe.
author: Marilyn vos Savant

quote: O, what a tangled web we weave when first we practise to deceive!
author: Walter Scott

quote: The doorstep to the temple of wisdom is a knowledge of our own ignorance.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: If you want a thing done well, do it yourself.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: He is no fool who gives what he cannot keep to gain what he cannot lose.
author: Jim Elliot

quote: Kisses are a better fate than wisdom.
author: e. e. cummings

quote: I have just three things to teach: simplicity, patience, compassion. These three are your greatest treasures.
author: Lao Tzu

quote: One's philosophy is not best expressed in words; it is expressed in the choices one makes... and the choices we make are ultimately our responsibility.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: Knowing others is wisdom, knowing yourself is Enlightenment.
author: Lao Tzu

quote: The older I grow the more I distrust the familiar doctrine that age brings wisdom.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: Without freedom of thought, there can be no such thing as wisdom - and no such thing as public liberty without freedom of speech.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Never interrupt someone doing what you said couldn't be done.
author: Amelia Earhart

quote: The young man knows the rules, but the old man knows the exceptions.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.

quote: Patience is the companion of wisdom.
author: Saint Augustine

quote: Set your course by the stars, not by the lights of every passing ship.
author: Omar N. Bradley

quote: Give me a lever long enough and a fulcrum on which to place it, and I shall move the world.
author: Archimedes

quote: Even if you're on the right track, you'll get run over if you just sit there.
author: Will Rogers

quote: Knowledge speaks, but wisdom listens.
author: Jimi Hendrix

quote: Be as you wish to seem.
author: Socrates

quote: Commitment is an act, not a word.
author: Jean-Paul Sartre

quote: Where there is charity and wisdom, there is neither fear nor ignorance.
author: Francis of Assisi

quote: Silence is the sleep that nourishes wisdom.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: If you only have a hammer, you tend to see every problem as a nail.
author: Abraham Maslow

quote: If you're trying to achieve, there will be roadblocks. I've had them; everybody has had them. But obstacles don't have to stop you. If you run into a wall, don't turn around and give up. Figure out how to climb it, go through it, or work around it.
author: Michael Jordan

quote: The three great essentials to achieve anything worth while are: Hard work, Stick-to-itiveness, and Common sense.
author: Thomas A. Edison

quote: Wisdom begins in wonder.
author: Socrates

quote: There are three classes of men; lovers of wisdom, lovers of honor, and lovers of gain.
author: Plato

quote: What makes Superman a hero is not that he has power, but that he has the wisdom and the maturity to use the power wisely. From an acting point of view, that's how I approached the part.
author: Christopher Reeve

quote: Step with care and great tact, and remember that Life's a Great Balancing Act.
author: Dr. Seuss

quote: Nobody can give you wiser advice than yourself.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: The pine stays green in winter... wisdom in hardship.
author: Norman Douglas

quote: Being entirely honest with oneself is a good exercise.
author: Sigmund Freud

quote: Always keep your mind as bright and clear as the vast sky, the great ocean, and the highest peak, empty of all thoughts. Always keep your body filled with light and heat. Fill yourself with the power of wisdom and enlightenment.
author: Morihei Ueshiba

quote: Democracy is a pathetic belief in the collective wisdom of individual ignorance.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: Outside of the cross of Jesus Christ, there is no hope in this world. That cross and resurrection at the core of the Gospel is the only hope for humanity. Wherever you go, ask God for wisdom on how to get that Gospel in, even in the toughest situations of life.
author: Ravi Zacharias

quote: We are what our thoughts have made us; so take care about what you think. Words are secondary. Thoughts live; they travel far.
author: Swami Vivekananda

quote: Who is wise in love, love most, say least.
author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

quote: True wisdom comes to each of us when we realize how little we understand about life, ourselves, and the world around us.
author: Socrates

quote: Experience is not what happens to you; it's what you do with what happens to you.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: The way a woman carries herself and the way she dresses ought to promote the following types of words: modesty, discretion, wisdom, beauty, elegance and refinement, but not sensuality, luxury, extravagance.
author: Paul Washer

quote: Beware, so long as you live, of judging men by their outward appearance.
author: Jean de La Fontaine

quote: This is what I learned: that everybody is talented, original and has something important to say.
author: Brenda Ueland

quote: If you talk to a man in a language he understands, that goes to his head. If you talk to him in his language, that goes to his heart.
author: Nelson Mandela

quote: A long habit of not thinking a thing wrong gives it a superficial appearance of being right.
author: Thomas Paine

quote: A day of worry is more exhausting than a week of work.
author: John Lubbock

quote: Blessed are those who give without remembering and take without forgetting.
author: Elizabeth Bibesco

quote: A charming woman... doesn't follow the crowd. She is herself.
author: Loretta Young

quote: It's easier to resist at the beginning than at the end.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

quote: He who learns must suffer. And even in our sleep pain that cannot forget falls drop by drop upon the heart, and in our own despair, against our will, comes wisdom to us by the awful grace of God.
author: Aeschylus

quote: Mistakes are the usual bridge between inexperience and wisdom.
author: Phyllis Theroux

quote: You can observe a lot by watching.
author: Yogi Berra

quote: The time to repair the roof is when the sun is shining.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Start with what is right rather than what is acceptable.
author: Franz Kafka

quote: Think big thoughts but relish small pleasures.
author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.

quote: I'd rather regret the things I've done than regret the things I haven't done.
author: Lucille Ball

quote: There are three methods to gaining wisdom. The first is reflection, which is the highest. The second is limitation, which is the easiest. The third is experience, which is the bitterest.
author: Confucius

quote: Let us be about setting high standards for life, love, creativity, and wisdom. If our expectations in these areas are low, we are not likely to experience wellness. Setting high standards makes every day and every decade worth looking forward to.
author: Greg Anderson

quote: The art of being wise is the art of knowing what to overlook.
author: William James

quote: Start wide, expand further, and never look back.
author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

quote: That old law about 'an eye for an eye' leaves everybody blind. The time is always right to do the right thing.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quote: Always seek out the seed of triumph in every adversity.
author: Og Mandino

quote: True knowledge exists in knowing that you know nothing.
author: Socrates

quote: Never tell people how to do things. Tell them what to do and they will surprise you with their ingenuity.
author: George S. Patton

quote: Your sacred space is where you can find yourself again and again.
author: Joseph Campbell

quote: We humans have lost the wisdom of genuinely resting and relaxing. We worry too much. We don't allow our bodies to heal, and we don't allow our minds and hearts to heal.
author: Thich Nhat Hanh

quote: The truth is not for all men, but only for those who seek it.
author: Ayn Rand

quote: People spend too much time finding other people to blame, too much energy finding excuses for not being what they are capable of being, and not enough energy putting themselves on the line, growing out of the past, and getting on with their lives.
author: J. Michael Straczynski

quote: What wisdom can you find that is greater than kindness?
author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

quote: Spectacular achievement is always preceded by unspectacular preparation.
author: Robert H. Schuller

quote: He who lives in harmony with himself lives in harmony with the universe.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Climb the mountains and get their good tidings.
author: John Muir

quote: Knowledge is knowing that a tomato is a fruit. Wisdom is knowing not to put it in a fruit salad.
author: Brian O'Driscoll

quote: The opinion which other people have of you is their problem, not yours.
author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross

quote: The higher we are placed, the more humbly we should walk.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: Always be a first-rate version of yourself, instead of a second-rate version of somebody else.
author: Judy Garland

quote: All things must come to the soul from its roots, from where it is planted.
author: Saint Teresa of Avila

quote: Never let your head hang down. Never give up and sit down and grieve. Find another way. And don't pray when it rains if you don't pray when the sun shines.
author: Richard M. Nixon

quote: Nothing that you have not given away will ever be really yours.
author: C. S. Lewis

quote: I look forward to a great future for America - a future in which our country will match its military strength with our moral restraint, its wealth with our wisdom, its power with our purpose.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: A wise man is superior to any insults which can be put upon him, and the best reply to unseemly behavior is patience and moderation.
author: Moliere

quote: There is more wisdom in your body than in your deepest philosophy.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: We gain the strength of the temptation we resist.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Keep me away from the wisdom which does not cry, the philosophy which does not laugh and the greatness which does not bow before children.
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: From the errors of others, a wise man corrects his own.
author: Publilius Syrus

quote: There is a wisdom of the head, and a wisdom of the heart.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: When in doubt, don't.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Turn your wounds into wisdom.
author: Oprah Winfrey

quote: I am not the first Buddha who came upon Earth, nor shall I be the last. In due time, another Buddha will arise in the world - a Holy One, a supremely enlightened One, endowed with wisdom in conduct, auspicious, knowing the universe, an incomparable leader of men, a master of angels and mortals.
author: Buddha

quote: To conquer fear is the beginning of wisdom.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Talent is God-given; be humble. Fame is man-given; be thankful. Conceit is self-given; be careful.
author: Harvey Mackay

quote: Of all the things which wisdom provides to make us entirely happy, much the greatest is the possession of friendship.
author: Epicurus

quote: The opportunity for brotherhood presents itself every time you meet a human being.
author: Jane Wyman

quote: True wisdom is less presuming than folly. The wise man doubteth often, and changeth his mind; the fool is obstinate, and doubteth not; he knoweth all things but his own ignorance.
author: Akhenaton

quote: The more sand that has escaped from the hourglass of our life, the clearer we should see through it.
author: Jean Paul

quote: The truest wisdom is a resolute determination.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: A loving heart is the truest wisdom.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: All human wisdom is summed up in two words; wait and hope.
author: Alexandre Dumas

quote: Hatred is corrosive of a person's wisdom and conscience; the mentality of enmity can poison a nation's spirit, instigate brutal life and death struggles, destroy a society's tolerance and humanity, and block a nation's progress to freedom and democracy.
author: Liu Xiaobo

quote: We respect our elders. There is wisdom that comes from experience, and I am not going to stop learning from wise counsel.
author: Marcia Fudge

quote: Wisdom consists of the anticipation of consequences.
author: Norman Cousins

quote: It has long been an axiom of mine that the little things are infinitely the most important.
author: Arthur Conan Doyle

quote: Through consciousness, our minds have the power to change our planet and ourselves. It is time we heed the wisdom of the ancient indigenous people and channel our consciousness and spirit to tend the garden and not destroy it.
author: Bruce Lipton

quote: God has already done everything He's going to do. The ball is now in your court. If you want success, if you want wisdom, if you want to be prosperous and healthy, you're going to have to do more than meditate and believe; you must boldly declare words of faith and victory over yourself and your family.
author: Joel Osteen

quote: With pride, there are many curses. With humility, there come many blessings.
author: Ezra Taft Benson

quote: People usually compare the computer to the head of the human being. I would say that hardware is the bone of the head, the skull. The semiconductor is the brain within the head. The software is the wisdom. And data is the knowledge.
author: Masayoshi Son

quote: The best way to predict the future is to invent it.
author: Alan Kay

quote: To wear your heart on your sleeve isn't a very good plan; you should wear it inside, where it functions best.
author: Margaret Thatcher

quote: Knowledge comes, but wisdom lingers.
author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

quote: The saddest aspect of life right now is that science gathers knowledge faster than society gathers wisdom.
author: Isaac Asimov

quote: Reality is merely an illusion, albeit a very persistent one.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Dost thou love life? Then do not squander time, for that is the stuff life is made of.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Sometimes I am happy and sometimes not. I am, after all, a human being, you know. And I am glad that we are sometimes happy and sometimes not. You get your wisdom working by having different emotions.
author: Yoko Ono

quote: You've got to go out on a limb sometimes because that's where the fruit is.
author: Will Rogers

quote: Life is a travelling to the edge of knowledge, then a leap taken.
author: D. H. Lawrence

quote: And I love that even in the toughest moments, when we're all sweating it - when we're worried that the bill won't pass, and it seems like all is lost - Barack never lets himself get distracted by the chatter and the noise. Just like his grandmother, he just keeps getting up and moving forward... with patience and wisdom, and courage and grace.
author: Michelle Obama

quote: Always keep an open mind and a compassionate heart.
author: Phil Jackson

quote: Men always talk about the most important things to perfect strangers. In the perfect stranger we perceive man himself; the image of a God is not disguised by resemblances to an uncle or doubts of wisdom of a mustache.
author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

quote: If you set out to be liked, you would be prepared to compromise on anything at any time, and you would achieve nothing.
author: Margaret Thatcher

quote: Follow your instincts. That's where true wisdom manifests itself.
author: Oprah Winfrey

quote: It's a horrible idea that God, this paragon of wisdom and knowledge, power, couldn't think of a better way to forgive us our sins than to come down to Earth in his alter ego as his son and have himself hideously tortured and executed so that he could forgive himself.
author: Richard Dawkins

quote: Use what talents you possess; the woods would be very silent if no birds sang there except those that sang best.
author: Henry Van Dyke

quote: Deliberately seek opportunities for kindness, sympathy, and patience.
author: Evelyn Underhill

quote: Only put off until tomorrow what you are willing to die having left undone.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: In dwelling, live close to the ground. In thinking, keep to the simple. In conflict, be fair and generous. In governing, don't try to control. In work, do what you enjoy. In family life, be completely present.
author: Lao Tzu

quote: In my life, I was always floating around the edge of the dark side and saying what if take it a little bit too far, and who says you have to stop there, and what's behind the next door. Maybe you gain a wisdom from examining those things. But after a while, you get too far down in the quicksand.
author: Trent Reznor

quote: Year's end is neither an end nor a beginning but a going on, with all the wisdom that experience can instill in us.
author: Hal Borland

quote: The Universal Zulu Nation stands to acknowledge wisdom, understanding, freedom, justice, and equality, peace, unity, love, and having fun, work, overcoming the negative through the positive, science, mathematics, faith, facts, and the wonders of God, whether we call him Allah, Jehovah, Yahweh, or Jah.
author: Afrika Bambaataa

quote: A poem begins in delight and ends in wisdom.
author: Robert Frost

quote: The superior man blames himself. The inferior man blames others.
author: Don Shula

quote: The teacher who is indeed wise does not bid you to enter the house of his wisdom but rather leads you to the threshold of your mind.
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: The motto of chivalry is also the motto of wisdom; to serve all, but love only one.
author: Honore de Balzac

quote: The war... was an unnecessary condition of affairs, and might have been avoided if forebearance and wisdom had been practiced on both sides.
author: Robert E. Lee

quote: The greatest obstacle to being heroic is the doubt whether one may not be going to prove one's self a fool; the truest heroism is to resist the doubt; and the profoundest wisdom, to know when it ought to be resisted, and when it be obeyed.
author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

quote: Wisdom is the right use of knowledge. To know is not to be wise. Many men know a great deal, and are all the greater fools for it. There is no fool so great a fool as a knowing fool. But to know how to use knowledge is to have wisdom.
author: Charles Spurgeon

quote: Once you label me you negate me.
author: Soren Kierkegaard

quote: A little knowledge that acts is worth infinitely more than much knowledge that is idle.
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: When a thing is done, it's done. Don't look back. Look forward to your next objective.
author: George C. Marshall

quote: In complete darkness we are all the same, it is only our knowledge and wisdom that separates us, don't let your eyes deceive you.
author: Janet Jackson

quote: Cunning... is but the low mimic of wisdom.
author: Plato

quote: Today's mighty oak is just yesterday's nut, that held its ground.
author: David Icke

quote: Where is the Life we have lost in living? Where is the wisdom we have lost in knowledge? Where is the knowledge we have lost in information?
author: T. S. Eliot

quote: Wisdom consists not so much in knowing what to do in the ultimate as knowing what to do next.
author: Herbert Hoover

quote: Remembering is painful, it's difficult, but it can be inspiring and it can give wisdom.
author: Paul Greengrass

quote: Every one in the world ought to do the things for which he is specially adapted. It is the part of wisdom to recognize what each one of us is best fitted for, and it is the part of education to perfect and utilize such predispositions. Because education can direct and aid nature but can never transform her.
author: Maria Montessori

quote: In world mythology, there are countless examples of tragic characters whose greatest strength is also the source of their undoing. But the ancient Greeks and Romans also held the view that acceptance is the beginning of wisdom.
author: Simon Van Booy

quote: We cannot become what we need to be by remaining what we are.
author: Max de Pree

quote: Every day, every birthday candle I blow out, every penny I throw over my shoulder in a wishing well, every time my daughter says, 'Let's make a wish on a star,' there's one thing I wish for: wisdom.
author: Rene Russo

quote: Sorrow is knowledge, those that know the most must mourn the deepest, the tree of knowledge is not the tree of life.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Some of the best lessons we ever learn are learned from past mistakes. The error of the past is the wisdom and success of the future.
author: Dale Turner

quote: How many cares one loses when one decides not to be something but to be someone.
author: Coco Chanel

quote: Appearances are often deceiving.
author: Aesop

quote: I praise loudly. I blame softly.
author: Catherine the Great

quote: Yesterday is history, tomorrow is a mystery, today is God's gift, that's why we call it the present.
author: Joan Rivers

quote: I acknowledge the privilege of being alive in a human body at this moment, endowed with senses, memories, emotions, thoughts, and the space of mind in its wisdom aspect.
author: Alex Grey

quote: We should not judge people by their peak of excellence; but by the distance they have traveled from the point where they started.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: You can only learn so much from books. You can only learn so much from education. Ultimately, it is the wisdom of God that will carry you through in the toughest situations of life.
author: Ravi Zacharias

quote: Music is your own experience, your own thoughts, your wisdom. If you don't live it, it won't come out of your horn. They teach you there's a boundary line to music. But, man, there's no boundary line to art.
author: Charlie Parker

quote: In wisdom gathered over time I have found that every experience is a form of exploration.
author: Ansel Adams

quote: There is a universal, intelligent, life force that exists within everyone and everything. It resides within each one of us as a deep wisdom, an inner knowing. We can access this wonderful source of knowledge and wisdom through our intuition, an inner sense that tells us what feels right and true for us at any given moment.
author: Shakti Gawain

quote: The wisdom of the wise and the experience of the ages is preserved into perpetuity by a nation's proverbs, fables, folk sayings and quotations.
author: William Feather

quote: A cardinal rule in budgeting and saving is to pay yourself first. Once your paycheck hits your account, wisdom has it that you should move some amount to savings even before you pay the bills.
author: John Rampton

quote: The wisdom of man never yet contrived a system of taxation that would operate with perfect equality.
author: Andrew Jackson

quote: It's not the having, it's the getting.
author: Elizabeth Taylor

quote: Silence at the proper season is wisdom, and better than any speech.
author: Plutarch

quote: Fear is the main source of superstition, and one of the main sources of cruelty. To conquer fear is the beginning of wisdom.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: An owl is traditionally a symbol of wisdom, so we are neither doves nor hawks but owls, and we are vigilant when others are resting.
author: Urjit Patel

quote: Seek the lofty by reading, hearing and seeing great work at some moment every day.
author: Thornton Wilder

quote: Everything comes to us that belongs to us if we create the capacity to receive it.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

quote: Science investigates; religion interprets. Science gives man knowledge which is power; religion gives man wisdom which is control.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quote: When written in Chinese, the word 'crisis' is composed of two characters. One represents danger and the other represents opportunity.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: The road of excess leads to the palace of wisdom.
author: William Blake

quote: Wise sayings often fall on barren ground, but a kind word is never thrown away.
author: Arthur Helps

quote: My advice to you is not to inquire why or whither, but just enjoy your ice cream while it's on your plate.
author: Thornton Wilder

quote: The final wisdom of life requires not the annulment of incongruity but the achievement of serenity within and above it.
author: Reinhold Niebuhr

quote: Success is not to be pursued; it is to be attracted by the person you become.
author: Jim Rohn

quote: The man of knowledge must be able not only to love his enemies but also to hate his friends.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: We are drowning in information, while starving for wisdom. The world henceforth will be run by synthesizers, people able to put together the right information at the right time, think critically about it, and make important choices wisely.
author: E. O. Wilson

quote: Wisdom comes alone through suffering.
author: Aeschylus

quote: There is a difference between happiness and wisdom: he that thinks himself the happiest man is really so; but he that thinks himself the wisest is generally the greatest fool.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: Swim upstream. Go the other way. Ignore the conventional wisdom.
author: Sam Walton

quote: Through mutual understanding, sincerity and goodwill, and with great wisdom and broad views, the leaders on both sides should jointly initiate new opportunities for peace, stability, cooperation and mutual benefit.
author: Chen Shui-bian

quote: The wisdom of the wise, and the experience of ages, may be preserved by quotation.
author: Isaac D'Israeli

quote: War involves in its progress such a train of unforeseen circumstances that no human wisdom can calculate the end; it has but one thing certain, and that is to increase taxes.
author: Thomas Paine

quote: The sweetest of all sounds is praise.
author: Xenophon

quote: The more tranquil a man becomes, the greater is his success, his influence, his power for good. Calmness of mind is one of the beautiful jewels of wisdom.
author: James Allen

quote: My father said there were two kinds of people in the world: givers and takers. The takers may eat better, but the givers sleep better.
author: Marlo Thomas

quote: I decided that it was not wisdom that enabled poets to write their poetry, but a kind of instinct or inspiration, such as you find in seers and prophets who deliver all their sublime messages without knowing in the least what they mean.
author: Socrates

quote: I think it's nice to age gracefully. OK, you lose the youth, a certain stamina and dewy glow, but what you gain on the inside as a human being is wonderful: the wisdom, the acceptance and the peace of mind. It's a fair exchange.
author: Cherie Lunghi

quote: The doors of wisdom are never shut.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: It is impossible to love and to be wise.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: I don't have the strength or wisdom to get through a single day without guidance and grace from God.
author: Tony Dungy

quote: Logic is the beginning of wisdom, not the end.
author: Leonard Nimoy

quote: Wisdom and penetration are the fruit of experience, not the lessons of retirement and leisure. Great necessities call out great virtues.
author: Abigail Adams

quote: Data is not information, information is not knowledge, knowledge is not understanding, understanding is not wisdom.
author: Clifford Stoll

quote: Never find fault with the absent.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: We don't receive wisdom; we must discover it for ourselves after a journey that no one can take for us or spare us.
author: Marcel Proust

quote: Influential people are never satisfied with the status quo. They're the ones who constantly ask, 'What if?' and 'Why not?' They're not afraid to challenge conventional wisdom, and they don't disrupt things for the sake of being disruptive; they do it to make things better.
author: Travis Bradberry

quote: Start with God - the first step in learning is bowing down to God; only fools thumb their noses at such wisdom and learning.
author: King Solomon

quote: Whatever position I occupied, it was the result of colleagues - of my comrades in the movement - who had decided in their wisdom to use me for the purpose of focusing the attention of the country and the international community on me.
author: Nelson Mandela

quote: If you have the guts to keep making mistakes, your wisdom and intelligence leap forward with huge momentum.
author: Holly Near

quote: Nine-tenths of wisdom is being wise in time.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

quote: The best way to obtain truth and wisdom is not to ask from books, but to go to God in prayer, and obtain divine teaching.
author: Joseph Smith, Jr.

quote: Wisdom is the reward you get for a lifetime of listening when you'd have preferred to talk.
author: Doug Larson

quote: The key to wisdom is this - constant and frequent questioning, for by doubting we are led to question and by questioning we arrive at the truth.
author: Peter Abelard

quote: Giving opens the way for receiving.
author: Florence Scovel Shinn

quote: Humanity's legacy of stories and storytelling is the most precious we have. All wisdom is in our stories and songs. A story is how we construct our experiences. At the very simplest, it can be: 'He/she was born, lived, died.' Probably that is the template of our stories - a beginning, middle, and end. This structure is in our minds.
author: Doris Lessing

quote: If we have built on the fragile cornerstones of human wisdom, pride, and conditional love, things may look good for a while, but a weak foundation causes collapse when storms hit.
author: Charles Stanley

quote: Both old and young alike ought to seek wisdom: the former in order that, as age comes over him, he may be young in good things because of the grace of what has been, and the latter in order that, while he is young, he may at the same time be old, because he has no fear of the things which are to come.
author: Epicurus

quote: If you call failures experiments, you can put them in your resume and claim them as achievements.
author: Mason Cooley

quote: Don't ask for a million dollars. Ask for the stuff that'll get you a million dollars - your health, your brain, your sanity, wisdom. Prepare me for when I do get that million. Make sure I don't go crazy, make sure I help my family.
author: Future

quote: The word philosophy sounds high-minded, but it simply means the love of wisdom. If you love something, you don't just read about it; you hug it, you mess with it, you play with it, you argue with it.
author: Hugh Jackman

quote: Regret for the things we did can be tempered by time; it is regret for the things we did not do that is inconsolable.
author: Sydney J. Harris

quote: It is like the seed put in the soil - the more one sows, the greater the harvest.
author: Orison Swett Marden

quote: This land, which we have watered with our tears and our blood, is now our mother country, and we are well satisfied to stay where wisdom abounds and gospel is free.
author: Richard V. Allen

quote: The figure a poem makes. It begins in delight and ends in wisdom... in a clarification of life - not necessarily a great clarification, such as sects and cults are founded on, but in a momentary stay against confusion.
author: Robert Frost

quote: When spirituality is the basis of your life, it gives you the strength, wisdom and courage to surmount the many storms of life that could destroy a weaker person who doesn't have this foundation.
author: Radhanath Swami

quote: Never reach out your hand unless you're willing to extend an arm.
author: Pope Paul VI

quote: Contrary to popular wisdom, the mark of a great meeting is not how short it is or whether it ends on time. The key is whether it ends with clarity and commitment from participants.
author: Patrick Lencioni

quote: We humans have lost the wisdom of genuinely resting and relaxing. We worry too much. We don't allow our bodies to heal, and we don't allow our minds and hearts to heal.
author: Nhat Hanh

quote: The virtue of justice consists in moderation, as regulated by wisdom.
author: Aristotle

quote: Doubt the conventional wisdom unless you can verify it with reason and experiment.
author: Steve Albini

quote: Most of our pocket wisdom is conceived for the use of mediocre people, to discourage them from ambitious attempts, and generally console them in their mediocrity.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: Sometimes you surprise yourself with what you can handle, and if you come out the other end with some wisdom, then it's not such a bad thing.
author: Boy George

quote: No man was ever wise by chance.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: The fall of dropping water wears away the Stone.
author: Lucretius

quote: The greatest obstacle to discovery is not ignorance - it is the illusion of knowledge.
author: Daniel J. Boorstin

quote: It is better to risk starving to death then surrender. If you give up on your dreams, what's left?
author: Jim Carrey

quote: The philosophy of life is this: Life is not a struggle, not a tension... Life is bliss. It is eternal wisdom, eternal existence.
author: Maharishi Mahesh Yogi

quote: Never give up, which is the lesson I learned from boxing. As soon as you learn to never give up, you have to learn the power and wisdom of unconditional surrender, and that one doesn't cancel out the other; they just exist as contradictions. The wisdom of it comes as you get older.
author: Kris Kristofferson

quote: God, give us grace to accept with serenity the things that cannot be changed, courage to change the things which should be changed and the wisdom to distinguish the one from the other.
author: Reinhold Niebuhr

quote: I have studied many philosophers and many cats. The wisdom of cats is infinitely superior.
author: Hippolyte Taine

quote: The man who makes everything that leads to happiness depends upon himself, and not upon other men, has adopted the very best plan for living happily. This is the man of moderation, the man of manly character and of wisdom.
author: Plato

quote: The greater our knowledge increases the more our ignorance unfolds.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: To light one candle to God and another to the Devil is the principle of wisdom.
author: Jose Bergamin

quote: They must often change, who would be constant in happiness or wisdom.
author: Confucius

quote: If you have the insight of non-self, if you have the insight of impermanence, you should make that insight into a concentration that you keep alive throughout the day. Then what you say, what you think, and what you do will then be in the light of that wisdom and you will avoid making mistakes and creating suffering.
author: Thich Nhat Hanh

quote: To know one's self is wisdom, but not to know one's neighbors is genius.
author: Minna Antrim

quote: No one who cooks, cooks alone. Even at her most solitary, a cook in the kitchen is surrounded by generations of cooks past, the advice and menus of cooks present, and the wisdom of cookbook writers.
author: Laurie Colwin

quote: It is a characteristic of wisdom not to do desperate things.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: With age comes common sense and wisdom.
author: Nas

quote: We all grow up. Hopefully, we get wiser. Age brings wisdom, and fatherhood changes one's life completely.
author: Frank Abagnale

quote: If you are bitter, you are like a dry leaf that you can just squash, and you can get blown away by the wind. There is much more wisdom in forgiveness.
author: Vusi Mahlasela

quote: To make no mistakes is not in the power of man; but from their errors and mistakes the wise and good learn wisdom for the future.
author: Plutarch

quote: Let no one be slow to seek wisdom when he is young nor weary in the search of it when he has grown old. For no age is too early or too late for the health of the soul.
author: Epicurus

quote: If you wish to reach the highest, begin at the lowest.
author: Publilius Syrus

quote: But life is long. And it is the long run that balances the short flare of interest and passion.
author: Sylvia Plath

quote: A good memory is surely a compost heap that converts experience to wisdom, creativity, or dottiness; not that these things are of much earthly value, but at least they may keep you amused when the world is keeping you locked away or shutting you out.
author: Michael Leunig

quote: Wise men make more opportunities than they find.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: I learned some valuable lessons about the legislative process, the importance of bipartisan cooperation and the wisdom of taking small steps to get a big job done.
author: Hillary Clinton

quote: Ignorant men raise questions that wise men answered a thousand years ago.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: Man is wise and constantly in quest of more wisdom; but the ultimate wisdom, which deals with beginnings, remains locked in a seed. There it lies, the simplest fact of the universe and at the same time the one which calls forth faith rather than reason.
author: Hal Borland

quote: The older I get the more wisdom I find in the ancient rule of taking first things first. A process which often reduces the most complex human problem to a manageable proportion.
author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

quote: Robots have already surpassed human beings in calculation and memory, but I have no doubt that the time will come when they will surpass in wisdom as well.
author: Masayoshi Son

quote: Now, if you notice how the swan, putting its neck down into the deep water, brings up food for itself from below, then you will discover the wisdom of the Creator, in that He gave it a neck longer than its feet for this reason, that it might, as if lowering a sort of fishing line, procure the food hidden in the deep water.
author: Saint Basil

quote: Few people have the wisdom to prefer the criticism that would do them good, to the praise that deceives them.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quote: I will give you a definition of a proud man: he is a man who has neither vanity nor wisdom one filled with hatreds cannot be vain, neither can he be wise.
author: John Keats

quote: If you want to go east, don't go west.
author: Ramakrishna

quote: During the long process of history, by relying on our own diligence, courage and wisdom, Chinese people have opened up a good and beautiful home where all ethnic groups live in harmony and fostered an excellent culture that never fades.
author: Xi Jinping

quote: A man begins cutting his wisdom teeth the first time he bites off more than he can chew.
author: Herb Caen

quote: Information is not knowledge, and knowledge is not wisdom. Reading - even browsing - an old book can yield sustenance denied by a database search. Patience is a virtue, gluttony a sin.
author: James Gleick

quote: While I have no empirical evidence to back this up, I bet that the number of homosexual people per thousand has not fluctuated all that much over the centuries. I do not believe the dented wisdom my father used to extol, that homosexuality was a sure sign of a civilization in decline.
author: Henry Rollins

quote: In life, all good things come hard, but wisdom is the hardest to come by.
author: Lucille Ball

quote: I believe that we are solely responsible for our choices, and we have to accept the consequences of every deed, word, and thought throughout our lifetime.
author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross

quote: Wisdom sails with wind and time.
author: John Florio

quote: The chief condition on which, life, health and vigor depend on, is action. It is by action that an organism develops its faculties, increases its energy, and attains the fulfillment of its destiny.
author: Colin Powell

quote: Applause is a receipt, not a bill.
author: Dale Carnegie

quote: It is the province of knowledge to speak, and it is the privilege of wisdom to listen.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.

quote: Wisdom is the power to put our time and our knowledge to the proper use.
author: Thomas J. Watson

quote: You are a product of your environment. So choose the environment that will best develop you toward your objective. Analyze your life in terms of its environment. Are the things around you helping you toward success - or are they holding you back?
author: W. Clement Stone

quote: If fortune favors you do not be elated; if she frowns do not despond.
author: Ausonius

quote: Rich people without wisdom and learning are but sheep with golden fleeces.
author: Solon

quote: You can't sweep other people off their feet, if you can't be swept off your own.
author: Clarence Day

quote: There is no greater privilege in living than bringing a tiny new human being into the world and then trying to raise him or her properly during the next eighteen years. Doing that job right requires all the intelligence, wisdom, and determination you will be able to muster from day to day.
author: James Dobson

quote: The attempt to combine wisdom and power has only rarely been successful and then only for a short while.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: A man should always consider how much he has more than he wants.
author: Joseph Addison

quote: Through the years, I, like you, have experienced pressures and disappointments that would have crushed me had I not been able to draw upon a source of wisdom and strength far greater than my own. He has never forgotten or forsaken me, and I have come to know for myself that Jesus is the Christ and that this is His Church.
author: Sheri L. Dew

quote: But the Wisdom of God, which is His only-begotten Son, being in all respects incapable of change or alteration, and every good quality in Him being essential, and such as cannot be changed and converted, His glory is therefore declared to be pure and sincere.
author: Origen

quote: We simply can no longer afford to deny the full potential of one half of the population. The world needs to tap into the talent and wisdom of women. Whether the issue is food security, economic recovery, health, or peace and security, the participation of women is needed now more than ever.
author: Michelle Bachelet

quote: Up until Trump announced his candidacy, the conventional wisdom was that you had to be a professional politician in order to run. You had to have a background that was politically scrubbed. In other words, smart people who didn't live perfect lives could never run.
author: Mark Cuban

quote: I do not believe in the collective wisdom of individual ignorance.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: It is good even for old men to learn wisdom.
author: Aeschylus

quote: Our wisdom comes from our experience, and our experience comes from our foolishness.
author: Sacha Guitry

quote: Good economic policy requires not so much the bravado to implement drastic change as the strength and wisdom to make reasonable trade-offs over the many years it takes to transform a country's standard of living.
author: Peter Blair Henry

quote: Evil can be a teacher, if you look at the wisdom of its negative power.
author: Tom Brown, Jr.

quote: Does wisdom perhaps appear on the earth as a raven which is inspired by the smell of carrion?
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: I pray before I go into the operating room for every case, and I ask him to give me wisdom, to help me to know what to do - and not only for operating, but for everything.
author: Ben Carson

quote: Trouble shared is trouble halved.
author: Lee Iacocca

quote: Wisdom outweighs any wealth.
author: Sophocles

quote: We must expect reverses, even defeats. They are sent to teach us wisdom and prudence, to call forth greater energies, and to prevent our falling into greater disasters.
author: Robert E. Lee

quote: A thought transfixed me: for the first time in my life, I saw the truth as it is set into song by so many poets, proclaimed as the final wisdom by so many thinkers. The truth - that love is the ultimate and the highest goal to which man can aspire.
author: Viktor E. Frankl

quote: My aim, then, was to whip the rebels, to humble their pride, to follow them to their inmost recesses, and make them fear and dread us. Fear is the beginning of wisdom.
author: William Tecumseh Sherman

quote: Tragedy is a tool for the living to gain wisdom, not a guide by which to live.
author: Robert Kennedy

quote: Cynicism masquerades as wisdom, but it is the furthest thing from it. Because cynics don't learn anything. Because cynicism is a self-imposed blindness: a rejection of the world because we are afraid it will hurt us or disappoint us. Cynics always say 'no.' But saying 'yes' begins things. Saying 'yes' is how things grow.
author: Stephen Colbert

quote: Memory is the mother of all wisdom.
author: Aeschylus

quote: Quick decisions are unsafe decisions.
author: Sophocles

quote: But what is liberty without wisdom, and without virtue? It is the greatest of all possible evils; for it is folly, vice, and madness, without tuition or restraint.
author: Edmund Burke

quote: Irony is the gaiety of reflection and the joy of wisdom.
author: Anatole France

quote: A monarchy conducted with infinite wisdom and infinite benevolence is the most perfect of all possible governments.
author: Ezra Stiles

quote: When you're young, you wonder what all these old people are droning on about, trying to impart their wisdom. It's not relevant to you because being young is such a specific thing. Thank God for that. Thank God for the young people who go out and demonstrate against rampant capitalism or whatever.
author: Helen Mirren

quote: It isn't what you do, but how you do it.
author: John Wooden

quote: Hurricane Katrina overwhelmed levees and exploded the conventional wisdom about a shared American prosperity, exposing a group of people so poor they didn't have $50 for a bus ticket out of town. If we want to learn something from this disaster, the lesson ought to be: America's poor deserve better than this.
author: Michael Eric Dyson

quote: A ruffled mind makes a restless pillow.
author: Charlotte Bronte

quote: All the great evils which men cause to each other because of certain intentions, desires, opinions, or religious principles, are likewise due to non-existence, because they originate in ignorance, which is absence of wisdom.
author: Maimonides

quote: When you get older, you learn certain life lessons. You apply that wisdom, and suddenly you say, 'Hey, I've got a new lease on this thing. So let's go.'
author: Robert Redford

quote: Cultures have long heard wisdom in non-human voices: Apollo, god of music, medicine and knowledge, came to Delphi in the form of a dolphin. But dolphins, which fill the oceans with blipping and chirping, and whales, which mew and caw in ultramarine jazz - a true rhapsody in blue - are hunted to the edge of silence.
author: Jay Griffiths

quote: A heart well prepared for adversity in bad times hopes, and in good times fears for a change in fortune.
author: Horace

quote: Earthly wisdom is doing what comes naturally. Godly wisdom is doing what the Holy Spirit compels us to do.
author: Charles Stanley

quote: Never cut what you can untie.
author: Joseph Joubert

quote: The day of fortune is like a harvest day, We must be busy when the corn is ripe.
author: Torquato Tasso

quote: Please all, and you will please none.
author: Aesop

quote: Each of us finds his unique vehicle for sharing with others his bit of wisdom.
author: Ram Dass

quote: Without courage, wisdom bears no fruit.
author: Baltasar Gracian

quote: History is filled with tragic examples of wars that result from diplomatic impasse. Whether in our local communities or in international relations, the skillful use of our communicative capacities to negotiate and resolve differences is the first evidence of human wisdom.
author: Daisaku Ikeda

quote: This is the highest wisdom that I own; freedom and life are earned by those alone who conquer them each day anew.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: The United Nations' founders understood that decisions affecting war and peace should happen only by consensus, and with America's consent, the veto by Security Council permanent members was enshrined in the United Nations Charter. The profound wisdom of this has underpinned the stability of international relations for decades.
author: Vladimir Putin

quote: Wisdom is the supreme part of happiness.
author: Sophocles

quote: It is better to rust out than wear out.
author: Edwin Markham

quote: Kindness is more important than wisdom, and the recognition of this is the beginning of wisdom.
author: Theodore Isaac Rubin

quote: The arts, quite simply, nourish the soul. They sustain, comfort, inspire. There is nothing like that exquisite moment when you first discover the beauty of connecting with others in celebration of larger ideals and shared wisdom.
author: Gordon Gee

quote: I hope our wisdom will grow with our power, and teach us, that the less we use our power the greater it will be.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: The most certain sign of wisdom is cheerfulness.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: Every silver lining has a cloud.
author: Mary Kay Ash

quote: Excellence, then, is a state concerned with choice, lying in a mean, relative to us, this being determined by reason and in the way in which the man of practical wisdom would determine it.
author: Aristotle

quote: When you doubt, abstain.
author: Ambrose Bierce

quote: Love is the wisdom of the fool and the folly of the wise.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Since human wisdom cannot secure us from accidents, it is the greatest effort of reason to bear them well.
author: John Paul Jones

quote: 'Swan,' by Mary Oliver. Poems and prose. Reading from this book is as if visiting a very wise friend. There is wisdom and welcoming kindness on every page.
author: Jessye Norman

quote: Wisdom is the knowledge of good and evil, not the strength to choose between the two.
author: John Cheever

quote: The left has come to regard common sense - the traditional wisdom and folkways of the community - as an obstacle to progress and enlightenment.
author: Christopher Lasch

quote: After the knowledge of, and obedience to, the will of God, the next aim must be to know something of His attributes of wisdom, power, and goodness as evidenced by His handiwork.
author: James Prescott Joule

quote: Repeat anything often enough and it will start to become you.
author: Tom Hopkins

quote: Imagination allows us to escape the predictable. It enables us to reply to the common wisdom that we cannot soar by saying, 'Just watch!'
author: Bill Bradley

quote: Holy wisdom confounds Satan and all his wickednesses.
author: Francis of Assisi

quote: Knowledge can be communicated, but not wisdom. One can find it, live it, be fortified by it, do wonders through it, but one cannot communicate and teach it.
author: Hermann Hesse

quote: In youth and beauty, wisdom is but rare!
author: Homer

quote: If we continue to develop our technology without wisdom or prudence, our servant may prove to be our executioner.
author: Omar N. Bradley

quote: I always felt called to serve, to empower and ennoble as many people as I could, teaching, truth-telling, exposing lies, bearing witness, and being willing to live and die for something bigger than yourself. I had a passion and love of learning and wisdom that was inseparable from a love of music and the arts.
author: Cornel West

quote: Children also have artistic ability, and there is wisdom in there having it! The more helpless they are, the more instructive are the examples they furnish us; and they must be preserved free of corruption from an early age.
author: Paul Klee

quote: And it is no less true, that personal security and private property rest entirely upon the wisdom, the stability, and the integrity of the courts of justice.
author: Joseph Story

quote: The lure of the distant and the difficult is deceptive. The great opportunity is where you are.
author: John Burroughs

quote: Our great power does not mean we can do whatever we want whenever we want, nor should we assume we have all the wisdom and knowledge necessary to succeed.
author: John McCain

quote: I imagine God to be like my father. My father was always the voice of certainty in my life. Certainty in the wisdom, certainty in the path, certainty always in God. For me God is certainty in everything. Certainty that everything is good and everything is God.
author: Yehuda Berg

quote: The greater the step forward in knowledge, the greater is the one taken backward in search of wisdom.
author: Stephen Gardiner

quote: The sum of wisdom is that time is never lost that is devoted to work.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: I know that inner wisdom is more precious than wealth. The more you spend it, the more you gain.
author: Oprah Winfrey

quote: Many sophisticated, intelligent people lack wisdom and common sense.
author: Joyce Meyer

quote: To keep your secret is wisdom; but to expect others to keep it is folly.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: First appearance deceives many.
author: Ovid

quote: One of the greatest pieces of economic wisdom is to know what you do not know.
author: John Kenneth Galbraith

quote: We must learn from the sermons of Christ, the wisdom of Laotzu, the teachings of Buddha.
author: Charles Lindbergh

quote: If men possessed wisdom, which stands in the same relation to the form of man as the sight to the eye, they would not cause any injury to themselves or to others; for the knowledge of truth removes hatred and quarrels, and prevents mutual injuries.
author: Maimonides

quote: In complete darkness, it is only knowledge and wisdom that separates us.
author: Janet Jackson

quote: As you walk in God's divine wisdom, you will surely begin to see a greater measure of victory and good success in your life.
author: Joseph Prince

quote: Each of us has been put on earth with the ability to do something well. We cheat ourselves and the world if we don't use that ability as best we can.
author: George Allen, Sr.

quote: Everyone has always underestimated a company headquartered in Salt Lake City, Utah. The New York boys thought they could take me on, that nobody out here has any knowledge or wisdom.
author: Jon Huntsman, Sr.

quote: There's something peculiar about writing fiction. It requires an interesting balance between seeing the world as a child and having the wisdom of a middle-aged person. The further you get from childhood and the experience of the teenage years, the greater the danger of losing that wellspring.
author: Kazuo Ishiguro

quote: We can't really digest food unless there's hunger. So we can't really assimilate spiritual wisdom unless we feel the need for it.
author: Radhanath Swami

quote: I consider wisdom supernatural because it isn't taught by men - it's a gift from God.
author: Joyce Meyer

quote: It is a common experience that a problem difficult at night is resolved in the morning after the committee of sleep has worked on it.
author: John Steinbeck

quote: Don't follow any advice, no matter how good, until you feel as deeply in your spirit as you think in your mind that the counsel is wise.
author: Joan Rivers

quote: If you were to offer a thirsty man all wisdom, you would not please him more than if you gave him a drink.
author: Sophocles

quote: Look twice before you leap.
author: Charlotte Bronte

quote: You know how people always talk about how vision is the key to entrepreneurship and perseverance and really seeing what other people don't see? We can actually redeem a fair amount of that folk wisdom.
author: Eric Ries

quote: I had more energy at 50. On the other hand, at 75, I've probably got a little more wisdom and good judgment than I had at 50 because I've got more experience. But I haven't really changed. I'm still driven by the same philosophy.
author: Ted Turner

quote: It doesn't matter how much wisdom you have. If you don't have position, you have nothing. That's the tragedy of India.
author: Rahul Gandhi

quote: To keep your secret is wisdom; to expect others to keep it is folly.
author: William Samuel Johnson

quote: Because in the school of the Spirit man learns wisdom through humility, knowledge by forgetting, how to speak by silence, how to live by dying.
author: Johannes Tauler

quote: For me, the perfect romantic suspense hero has got to be tough on the outside but tender at his core. A take-charge kind of guy who has his own inner strength and a strong sense of right and wrong - which might not dovetail with the conventional wisdom. I mean, he might bend the law if he thinks the ends justify the means.
author: Ruth Glick

quote: I love wisdom. And you can never be great at anything unless you love it. Not be in love with it, but love the thing, admire the thing. And it seems that if you love the thing, and you don't just want to possess it, it will find you.
author: Maya Angelou

quote: If I don't have wisdom, I can teach you only ignorance.
author: Leo Buscaglia

quote: When an opponent comes forward, move in and greet him; if he wants to pull back, send him on his way.
author: Morihei Ueshiba

quote: It is much more difficult to measure nonperformance than performance.
author: Harold S. Geneen

quote: A closed mouth catches no flies.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: If you do not express your own original ideas, if you do not listen to your own being, you will have betrayed yourself.
author: Rollo May

quote: Let us act on what we have, since we have not what we wish.
author: John Henry Newman

quote: A mouse does not rely on just one hole.
author: Plautus

quote: Knowledge is proud that it knows so much; wisdom is humble that it knows no more.
author: William Cowper

quote: Wisdom doesn't necessarily come with age. Sometimes age just shows up all by itself.
author: Tom Wilson

quote: Most people see what they expect to see, what they want to see, what they've been told to see, what conventional wisdom tells them to see - not what is right in front of them in its pristine condition.
author: Vincent Bugliosi

quote: What is man's ultimate direction in life? It is to look for love, truth, virtue, and beauty.
author: Shinichi Suzuki

quote: It takes a great man to give sound advice tactfully, but a greater to accept it graciously.
author: Logan Pearsall Smith

quote: Wisdom is knowing when you can't be wise.
author: Paul Engle

quote: Genius unrefined resembles a flash of lightning, but wisdom is like the sun.
author: Franz Grillparzer

quote: It took me a long time to learn how to be brave enough to put myself out there and try everything, no matter how strange or silly. If I can impart that same wisdom to other folks - no matter what age - it would be an honor.
author: Alethea Kontis

quote: Wisdom is a kind of knowledge. It is knowledge of the nature, career, and consequences of human values.
author: Sidney Hook

quote: Many of us spend half of our time wishing for things we could have if we didn't spend half our time wishing.
author: Alexander Woollcott

quote: I believe that when an elder dies, a library is burned: vast sums of wisdom and knowledge are lost. Throughout the world libraries are ablaze with scant attention.
author: Elizabeth Kapu'uwailani Lindsey

quote: Pain and foolishness lead to great bliss and complete knowledge, for Eternal Wisdom created nothing under the sun in vain.
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: Both in thought and in feeling, even though time be real, to realise the unimportance of time is the gate of wisdom.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Experience - the wisdom that enables us to recognise in an undesirable old acquaintance the folly that we have already embraced.
author: Ambrose Bierce

quote: You know, many people have said that I'm on the edge and I'm maverick for some of the big operations that I've done. I'm not at all. I pray; I ask God to give me wisdom, 'Should I do it?', guidance in terms of how to do it, who to consult with. All those kind of things are incredibly important.
author: Ben Carson

quote: Science gives us knowledge, but only philosophy can give us wisdom.
author: Will Durant

quote: It is astonishing what force, purity, and wisdom it requires for a human being to keep clear of falsehoods.
author: Margaret Fuller

quote: They whom truth and wisdom lead, can gather honey from a weed.
author: William Cowper

quote: Morality comes with the sad wisdom of age, when the sense of curiosity has withered.
author: Graham Greene

quote: All conventional wisdom has an element of truth to it, but good design requires more than an element of truth - it requires an ensemble of correct assumptions and valid calculations.
author: Henry Petroski

quote: While people are quick to praise the wisdom of the crowd, being an old-school journalist, I look at the wisdom of the crowd and know it can quickly turn into a mob mentality.
author: Jason Calacanis

quote: By definition, the Singularity means that machines would be smarter than us, and, in their wisdom, they can innovate new technologies. The innovations would come so quickly, and increasingly quickly, that the innovation would make Moore's Law seem as antiquated as Hammurabi's Code.
author: Marvin Ammori

quote: When you betray somebody else, you also betray yourself.
author: Isaac Bashevis Singer

quote: There is no pain equal to that which two lovers can inflict on one another. This should be made clear to all who contemplate such a union. The avoidance of this pain is the beginning of wisdom, for it is strong enough to contaminate the rest of our lives.
author: Cyril Connolly

quote: Authority without wisdom is like a heavy ax without an edge, fitter to bruise than polish.
author: Anne Bradstreet

quote: Ending poverty calls for humility, honesty, freedom from ideology and refusal to accept cruel simplicities about anyone's human potential. It requires listening to the wisdom and cutting the nonsense from both the Right and the Left.
author: Donella Meadows

quote: I've led a school whose faculty and students examine and discuss and debate every aspect of our law and legal system. And what I've learned most is that no one has a monopoly on truth or wisdom. I've learned that we make progress by listening to each other, across every apparent political or ideological divide.
author: Elena Kagan

quote: Wisdom is knowing what to do next; virtue is doing it.
author: David Starr Jordan

quote: Losing faith in your own singularity is the start of wisdom, I suppose; also the first announcement of death.
author: Peter Conrad

quote: Ignorance and bungling with love are better than wisdom and skill without.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: No party has a monopoly on wisdom. No democracy works without compromise. But when Governor Romney and his allies in Congress tell us we can somehow lower our deficit by spending trillions more on new tax breaks for the wealthy - well, you do the math. I refuse to go along with that. And as long as I'm President, I never will.
author: Barack Obama

quote: Magnanimity in politics is not seldom the truest wisdom; and a great empire and little minds go ill together.
author: Edmund Burke

quote: It seems to me that, in every culture, I come across a chapter headed 'Wisdom.' And then I know exactly what is going to follow: 'Vanity of vanities, all is vanity.'
author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

quote: For all my education, accomplishments, and so called 'wisdom'... I can't fathom my own heart.
author: Michael Caine

quote: It is wisdom in prosperity, when all is as thou wouldn't have it, to fear and suspect the worst.
author: Desiderius Erasmus

quote: The only medicine for suffering, crime, and all other woes of mankind, is wisdom. Teach a man to read and write, and you have put into his hands the great keys of the wisdom box. But it is quite another thing to open the box.
author: Thomas Huxley

quote: It is not who is right, but what is right, that is of importance.
author: Thomas Huxley

quote: For the men and women of the FBI, bravery is reflected not only in the physical courage often necessary in the job. It can be seen in the courage of conviction, in the courage to act with wisdom in the face of fear, and in the courage it takes to admit mistakes and move forward.
author: Robert Mueller

quote: Wisdom and understanding can only become the possession of individual men by travelling the old road of observation, attention, perseverance, and industry.
author: Samuel Smiles

quote: I have learned throughout my life as a composer chiefly through my mistakes and pursuits of false assumptions, not by my exposure to founts of wisdom and knowledge.
author: Igor Stravinsky

quote: This age thinks better of a gilded fool Than of a threadbare saint in wisdom's school.
author: Thomas Dekker

quote: Moderation is the inseparable companion of wisdom, but with it genius has not even a nodding acquaintance.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote: I associate wisdom and grace with age.
author: Christy Turlington

quote: I don't turn to greeting cards for wisdom and advice, but they are a fine reflection of the general drift of the culture.
author: Susan Orlean

quote: With age comes a greater wisdom, an ease and comfort with oneself.
author: Cherie Lunghi

quote: Age does not bring you wisdom, age brings you wrinkles.
author: Estelle Getty

quote: Tis but a part we see, and not a whole.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: Better be wise by the misfortunes of others than by your own.
author: Aesop

quote: The less you talk, the more you're listened to.
author: Pauline Phillips

quote: Let my skin and sinews and bones dry up, together with all the flesh and blood of my body! I welcome it! But I will not move from this spot until I have attained the supreme and final wisdom.
author: Buddha

quote: We live in a society bloated with data yet starved for wisdom. We're connected 24/7, yet anxiety, fear, depression and loneliness is at an all-time high. We must course-correct.
author: Elizabeth Kapu'uwailani Lindsey

quote: In an era in which war and terrorism - at home and abroad - are often based on racial, religious and ethnic differences, rediscovering the wisdom of love and compassion may help us increase our survival at a time when an increasingly divided country and world so badly need it.
author: Dean Ornish

quote: The smallest deed is better than the greatest intention.
author: John Burroughs

quote: Being a survivor doesn't mean being strong - it's telling people when you need a meal or a ride, company, whatever. It's paying attention to heart wisdom, feelings, not living a role, but having a unique, authentic life, having something to contribute, finding time to love and laugh. All these things are qualities of survivors.
author: Bernie Siegel

quote: Be happy. It's one way of being wise.
author: Sidonie Gabrielle Colette

quote: A promise made is a debt unpaid.
author: Robert W. Service

quote: The Gross National Product measures neither our wit nor our courage, neither our wisdom nor our learning, neither our compassion nor our devotion to our country. It measures everything, in short, except that which makes life worthwhile, and it can tell us everything about America - except whether we are proud to be Americans.
author: Robert Kennedy

quote: Whenever you argue with another wiser than yourself in order that others may admire your wisdom, they will discover your ignorance.
author: Saadi

quote: Wisdom ceases to be wisdom when it becomes too proud to weep, too grave to laugh, and too selfish to seek other than itself.
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: Meditation is the soul's perspective glass.
author: Owen Feltham

quote: To be satisfied with a little, is the greatest wisdom; and he that increaseth his riches, increaseth his cares; but a contented mind is a hidden treasure, and trouble findeth it not.
author: Akhenaton

quote: Nobility of spirit has more to do with simplicity than ostentation, wisdom rather than wealth, commitment rather than ambition.
author: Riccardo Muti

quote: The more I draw and write, the more I realise that accidents are a necessary part of any creative act, much more so than logic or wisdom. Sometimes a mistake is the only way of arriving at an original concept, and the history of successful inventions is full of mishaps, serendipity and unintended results.
author: Shaun Tan

quote: Pure, holy simplicity confounds all the wisdom of this world and the wisdom of the flesh.
author: Francis of Assisi

quote: If suffering brings wisdom, I would wish to be less wise.
author: William Butler Yeats

quote: We never understand how little we need in this world until we know the loss of it.
author: James M. Barrie

quote: Intuition is the wisdom formed by feeling and instinct - a gift of knowing without reasoning... Belief is ignited by hope and supported by facts and evidence - it builds alignment and creates confidence. Belief is what sets energy in motion and creates the success that breeds more success.
author: Angela Ahrendts

quote: As you walk down the fairway of life you must smell the roses, for you only get to play one round.
author: Ben Hogan

quote: What has history said of eminence without honor, wealth without wisdom, power and possessions without principle? The answer is reiterated in the overthrow of the mightiest empires of ancient times. Babylon, Persia, Greece, Rome! The four successive, universal powers of the past. What and where are they?
author: Orson F. Whitney

quote: Singleness of purpose is one of the chief essentials for success in life, no matter what may be one's aim.
author: John D. Rockefeller

quote: Don't taunt the alligator until after you've crossed the creek.
author: Dan Rather

quote: To avoid entangling alliances has been a maxim of our policy ever since the days of Washington, and its wisdom no one will attempt to dispute.
author: James Buchanan

quote: I think I got a lot of life skills; I got a lot of wisdom; I've seen a lot of bad things happen to a lot of good people.
author: Young Jeezy

quote: Vanity can easily overtake wisdom. It usually overtakes common sense.
author: Julian Casablancas

quote: Knowledge without justice ought to be called cunning rather than wisdom.
author: Plato

quote: The function of wisdom is to discriminate between good and evil.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: The hours of folly are measured by the clock; but of wisdom, no clock can measure.
author: William Blake

quote: No one wants advice - only corroboration.
author: John Steinbeck

quote: If the world were perfect, it wouldn't be.
author: Yogi Berra

quote: When you give yourself, you receive more than you give.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

quote: Common sense in an uncommon degree is what the world calls wisdom.
author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

quote: Raising children is an incredibly hard and risky business in which no cumulative wisdom is gained: each generation repeats the mistakes the previous one made.
author: Bill Cosby

quote: Look around for a place to sow a few seeds.
author: Henry Van Dyke

quote: The invariable mark of wisdom is to see the miraculous in the common.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Wisdom does not show itself so much in precept as in life - in firmness of mind and a mastery of appetite. It teaches us to do as well as to talk; and to make our words and actions all of a color.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: To profit from good advice requires more wisdom than to give it.
author: Wilson Mizner

quote: Nature and books belong to the eyes that see them.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Before we acquire great power we must acquire wisdom to use it well.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: The philosophies of one age have become the absurdities of the next, and the foolishness of yesterday has become the wisdom of tomorrow.
author: William Osler

quote: Great wisdom is generous; petty wisdom is contentious. Great speech is impassioned, small speech cantankerous.
author: Zhuangzi

quote: It is essential to employ, trust, and reward those whose perspective, ability, and judgment are radically different from yours. It is also rare, for it requires uncommon humility, tolerance, and wisdom.
author: Dee Hock

quote: Our shared values define us more than our differences. And acknowledging those shared values can see us through our challenges today if we have the wisdom to trust in them again.
author: John McCain

quote: For the Holy Ghost blesses us with optimism and wisdom at times of challenge that we simply cannot muster on our own.
author: Sheri L. Dew

quote: Lord, bless me with the ability to achieve all that I can, and the wisdom to realize it doesn't all have to be by tomorrow!
author: William Eardley IV

quote: Wisdom is nothing but a preparation of the soul, a capacity, a secret art of thinking, feeling and breathing thoughts of unity at every moment of life.
author: Herman Hesse
